quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Whitney Houston and Stairway
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cosby, bass. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the choices below is the acceptable chord progression for Bob Marleys, I shot the Sheriff(capo up 2).

options.text: Chorus Bm,  Dm, 3x, riff    verse F, Am,  Cm, 3x, riff.
Chorus Em,  Am, 3x, riff    verse C, Bm,  Em, 3x, riff.
Chorus Dm,  Gm, 3x, riff    verse R, Qm,  Zm, 3x, riff.
Chorus F#m,  Am, 3x, riff    verse C, F,  F#7, 3x, riff.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chorus Em,  Am, 3x, riff    verse C, Bm,  Em, 3x, riff.

questions.question: Which of these is a technique of playing guitar bass notes (usually one, two or three), during a chord change, to move up or down to the root note of the new chord?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walking Bass

questions.question: With what record label did Whitney Houston sign a contract in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arista

questions.question: How many songs did Whitney Houston contribute to the Waiting to Exhale soundtrack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: three

questions.question: Which of the following has listed Whitney Houston as musics most awarded female of all time?

options.text: The Guinness Book of World Records

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Guinness Book of World Records

questions.question: On what date did Whitney Houston and Bobby Browns divorce become final?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: April 24, 2007

questions.question: How many songs did Whitney Houston record on the soundtrack to The Bodyguard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: six

questions.question: Which of these techniques is used in many styles of play to raise or lower the pitch of a note or notes (usually for a one or two fret value)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bend and release

questions.question: How many consecutive #1 Billboard Hot 100 hits did Whitney Houston have in 1987?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: seven

questions.question: Did Whitney Houston release her first album titled Whitney Houston in 1985?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What is the name of Whitney Houstons character in the movie Waiting to Exhale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Savannah Jackson

questions.question: The sign in the music shop in Waynes World reads, No Stairway.” The reference, of course, is to Led Zepplins 1971 mega-hit song, Stairway to Heaven.” This song, along with the Eagles Hotel California, is one of the most commonly attempted songs by aspiring pop/rock/blues guitar players. What key is Stairway to Heaven written in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Am

questions.question: Did Whitney Houston appear on an episode of The Cosby Show as herself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The Mississippi delta was shining like a national guitar is the opening line of Paul Simons song Graceland.” What does national guitar mean?

options.text: It refers to a solid silver guitar awarded annually at the Lincoln Center, New York. Paul Simon was the awarded musician in 1976.
This line is to honor the great Delta Blues players of the past, e.g. Robert Johnson.
Cheap and shiny finished, National Guitars were guitars sold by Sears  Roebuck from the 1930s to the 1970s.
A National Guitar is a stainless steel guitar manufactured by National Reso-phonic Guitars, Inc.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A National Guitar is a stainless steel guitar manufactured by National Reso-phonic Guitars, Inc.

questions.question: On what date did Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown marry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: July 18, 1992

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Seconds and Songs
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, parts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the debut album of alternative rock band 30 Seconds to Mars, released in 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 30 Seconds to Mars

questions.question: Which one of these is not a lyric of the song Minority by Green Day?

options.text: One nation in the dark, there of which I stand alone
Blinded by the silence of a thousand broken hearts
A face in the crowd, unsung against the mould

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One nation in the dark, there of which I stand alone

questions.question: Green Day were originally called The Hungry Mutants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the real name of Green Days member Tre Cool?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Edwin Wright III

questions.question: Which of the lines gives the correct names of Green Days core band members (since 1990)?

options.text: Billie Joe Armstrong, MIke Dirnt and Tre Cool
Billie Joe Armstrong, Mike Pritchard and John Kiffmeyer
Billie Joe Armstrong, Mike Dirnt and Al Sobrante
Billie Bob Thorton, Michael Jordan and Frank Lero

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Joe Armstrong, MIke Dirnt and Tre Cool

questions.question: Which of these songs / parts of songs are all sung by Tre Cool?

options.text: All By Myself  Rock n Roll Girlfriend (from the medley Homecoming)
All By Myself, Dominated Love Slave  Rock n Roll Girlfriend
All By Myself, Dominated Love Slave, Rock n Roll Girlfriend  Knowledge
All alone, Dominated Love Slave  My Cat has a nose

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All By Myself, Dominated Love Slave  Rock n Roll Girlfriend

questions.question: How did Green Day member Mike Dirnt get his last name?

options.text: He just liked the surname Dirnt.
He was adopted by the Dirnt family.
His mother misspelled Dirt on his birth certificate.
He used to pretend to play bass in school by singing dirnt dirnt dirnt all the time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He used to pretend to play bass in school by singing dirnt dirnt dirnt all the time.

questions.question: The rock band Green Day never do cover songs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Billie Joe, Mike and Tre from Green Day were born in one and the same year. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: The cover artwork for Green Days album Insomniac is called God Told Me To Skin You Alive.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is not a 30 Seconds to Mars song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rebuilding Heaven

questions.question: Is Tim Armstrong from Rancid the brother of guitarist Billie Joe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which of the lines contains all of Green Days album / CD titles released before the year 2006?

options.text: 1039/Smoothed Out Slappy Hours, Kerplunk!, Dookie, Insomniac, nimrod., Warning, International Superhits!, Shenanigans, American Idiot  Bullet in a Bible
Dookie, Insomniac, Nimrod, Warning, Shenanigans, American Idiot  Bullet in a Bible
American Idiot, Going Under, The Sound of Silence, Angus, Dookie
1039/Smoothed Out Slappy Hours, Kerplunk!, Dookie, Angus  American Idiot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1039/Smoothed Out Slappy Hours, Kerplunk!, Dookie, Insomniac, nimrod., Warning, International Superhits!, Shenanigans, American Idiot  Bullet in a Bible

questions.question: Which Hollywood actor is famous as a founding member and frontman of the band 30 Seconds to Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jared Leto

questions.question: What is Al Sobrantes relation to Green Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Days first ever drummer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Aida and Opera
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, creators. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which statement is untrue about the main character of the opera Aida?

options.text: In the opera, Aida is a Roman Empress.
In the opera, Aida has royal blood.
The 1987 movie version of Aida is performed topless.
In the opera, Aida is a slave girl.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the opera, Aida is a Roman Empress.

questions.question: In which country do the events of the opera Aida take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: This influential pianist, one of the creators of the Cool jazz, explored modal jazz with Miles Davis and John Coltrane before forming his own trio.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Evans

questions.question: Who is the keyboard player/ leader of Return to Forever?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chick Corea

questions.question: When Giuseppe Verdi conducted Aida at the La Scala opera house, the opera was a success.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who commissioned composing of the opera Aida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ismail Pasha

questions.question: Which piano and organ player was a key part of the sound of Vermont-based band Phish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Page McConnell

questions.question: Who is the whiz-kid organ and keyboard player considered by many to be the Fifth Beatle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Preston

questions.question: In terms of acts, how long is the opera Aida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 acts

questions.question: Where was Aidas premier performance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cairo

questions.question: Name the fluid piano player who replaced founding member Ron Pigpen McKernan in the Grateful Dead.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keith Godchaux

questions.question: Approximately how much, in terms of American dollars, was Verdi paid for Aida?

options.text: Nothing - he was only paid a percentage of the gate.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $20,000

questions.question: Which of these is not an aria from Aida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stride la vampa

questions.question: How many operas did Italian opera composer Giuseppe Verdi compose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28

questions.question: Instead of replacing guitarist Duane Allman (who died in a motorcycle accident in 1971) with another guitarist, the Brothers added this great piano player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Leavell
